content.question:
<math alttext="C l 2 O, gas, plus H 2 O, gas, is in equilibrium with 2 H O C l, gas, where delta H naught equals, positive 13 kilojoules per mole of reaction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Cl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mpadded><mo>⇄</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>HOCl</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mtext>Δ</mtext><msup><mi>H</mi><mo>∘</mo></msup></mpadded><mo>=</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>13</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kJ</mi><mo>/</mo><msub><mi>mol</mi><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></math>
A chemical system at equilibrium is represented above. Which of the following changes will increase the number of moles of <math alttext="H O C l, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>HOCl</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> present in the system?

choices.label: Decreasing the volume of the reaction vessel

Removing <math alttext="C l 2 O, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Cl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>

skill.text: 4.A: Predict and/or explain chemical properties or phenomena (e.g., of atoms or molecules) using given chemical theories, models, and representations.
